attributes.action: make BAA alter its name, ensuring that ‘British’ is not linked with any ecological ill-effects caused by flights from its airports
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As ‘BAA’ no longer stands for “British Airports Authority,” and the company is now Spanish owned, the ‘B’ should no longer be used by this company.  ‘British’ could not then be associated with businesses profiting from the refusal to fully compensate for the atmospheric damage created by flights taking off and landing at its facilities. Nor should British be linked with the extra pollution caused by BAA refusing to assist in the installation of better rail facilities to the airports, preferring to use British land to create new car parks, giving it an even larger profit margin. As a foreign company, it is further damaging this country by encouraging other foreign firms to fly too many flights, demonstrated by the fact that free seats are offered to fly out of Britain.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
